page.title: 05Religion
page.content: In common with many other areas of the country, "Church-going" has steadily declined in recent years. At the Church of St.Philip and St. James in Kimblesworth attendances vary between 30 and 40 each Sunday. Due to lack of interest there is no longer a "Sunday School" at the local chapel in Nettlesworth. (Churches in Sacriston are outside this "Block" with the exception of the Salvation Army Citadel.) It seems a great pity because once there were two chapels in Kimblesworth -their choirs entered Eistedfods- one even won a cup .Sunday School anniversaries were occasions when everyone had new clothes to show off.
